meanings.definition: An authorization granted by a government or company to an individual or group enabling them to carry out specified commercial activities.
meanings.sent1: The local bakery obtained a franchise to sell famous donuts.
meanings.sent2: She purchased a franchise to open a new coffee shop in town.
meanings.sent3: The cat somehow got a franchise to nap in the sunniest spot in the house.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a franchise, granting access to everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent5: The franchise to explore the enchanted forest was a dream come true for the children.

meanings.definition: A right or privilege officially granted to a person or group by a government or company.
meanings.sent1: The franchise to host the event was given to the most experienced team.
meanings.sent2: He was excited to receive the franchise to operate his own business.
meanings.sent3: The penguin seemed to have a franchise to slide on the icy slopes effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a franchise that brightened up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: Winning the franchise to lead the expedition filled him with pride and responsibility.
